poem:
Title: "The Ballad of the Ballot"

In the autumn of the ballot box,
Among rajasthan's plains and rocks,
Echoes a voice, stern and grim, 
A melody of hate's grim hymn.
"Usurper, interloper," it cries,
An enemy, in friend's guise. 
One man's politics of fear,
Two hundred million live in fear.
Yet the ink of journalism bleeds,
A counter note to divisive deeds.
